intro: Catostemma lemense, commonly known as the African moonvine, is a climbing plant native to tropical Africa. It belongs to the family Menispermaceae and is characterized by its slender, twining stems and heart-shaped leaves. The plant produces small, greenish-yellow flowers that are followed by elongated, woody fruits. Its roots are often used in traditional medicine for their purported health benefits. The botanical features of Catostemma lemense make it an interesting subject for both ecological and pharmacological studies.
